channel.title: Need help with an interface
channel.description:
Hey guys ive just come across the 317 grand exchange by linksbro it uses delta interfaces heres a picture of what it looks like:
[img]http://i234.photobucket.com/albums/ee118/1337Linksbro/ge2.jpg[/img]
please can someone help me with an example of how to make it use the shop interface?
here's the link to linksbro's thread of the grand exchange he released:
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=331554.0]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=331554.0[/url]
heres the tutorial he made on rune-server on how to add it:
[url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/151782-linksbros-grand-exchange-v1.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/151782-linksbros-grand-exchange-v1.html[/url]

item.title: Need help with an interface
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

That will probably have to be done client sided under class8 or ItemDef (renamed/refractored).

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with an interface
item.dc:creator: @EclipsedSkapez EclipsedSkapez
item.description:
@EclipsedSkapez wrote:

some delta servers have a item id next to the item when you right click it is their a method for that?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with an interface
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

They could use an item list such as ItemDB, however you could hard code them in or just search the entries via your item configuration file.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with an interface
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

What do you mean with the grandexchange code? The grand exchange interface?
If you added the interface via a tutorial normally the IDs to send variables to would of been shown in an image or by text, i.e.

OKAY WE HAVE ADDED IT SENDQUEST 1-6 WILL CHANGE THE NAME OF THE ITEMS IN THE BOXES LEFT TO RIGHT

Then you could just do something like:-

for (int i = 1; i < 7; i++) c.sendQuest(Ge.getItemForSlot(i), i);

But then you would have to have a class handling the Grand Exchange, which is what I would do.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with an interface
item.dc:creator: @EclipsedSkapez EclipsedSkapez
item.description:
@EclipsedSkapez wrote:

Great idea but I need it to use the actual shop interface so you can see the items for sale
thanks very much though

EDIT: very nice peice of code but could you show me how to implement it with the grand exchange code

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with an interface
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

You could edit the interface via the cache to look like the shop interface, or you could just ‘paint’ it onto a shop interface by generating an interface everytime the method is called from scratch.

Something similar to:-

void showGe() { c.sendInterface(shopInterface); //add the components to the interface however it is done at other places in your source c.flush(); }

Then show it up if someone pressed a button or enters a command.

Read full topic
